newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Strong demand lifts values.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Strong demand lifts values.

text.p: Millfeed prices moved higher at most locations, with dealers reporting a surge in demand for promptly shipped material.

Scheduled downtime at flour mills for routine fumigation and for the U.S. Labor Day holiday September 2 has feed mixers actively bidding for product. Flour mills have sold much of their upcoming production and raised prices for the remainder of the output.
In the Southeast, dealers said feed mixers continued to buy millfeeds for hog and poultry rations despite the availability of new-crop corn.
"There is not near enough corn for the demand," said a Chattanooga dealer, who said more millfeeds are going into hog rations.
The closely-watched Kansas City rail market was higher, with bids and offers up $6.00 at $114 and $116 per ton, respectively.
